message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GR 

The paper deals with scene understanding, which is a core problem in computer vision. Specifically, it focuses on semantic stereo matching, which involves inferring both the 3D structure and content of a scene from stereo images. This problem is relevant to several fields, including robotics, self-navigation, and augmented reality. The proposed solution is a deep neural network architecture that performs both tasks in a single pass, using a coarse-to-fine approach. The paper emphasizes the efficiency of the proposed method, which can run in real-time on embedded devices. Based on these characteristics, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is computer vision (cs.CV). Other relevant sub-categories include robotics (cs.RO), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), and graphics (cs.GR).
